conclusion: Understand the setup of the coil with n turns and length L in a uniform magnetic field B, perpendicular to the coil plane, with current I.
Initially, balance is achieved with current in one direction, and magnetic force is given by F = nILB.
When the current is reversed, the direction of the magnetic force on the coil also reverses.
To re-establish balance, an additional weight m is added to the left pan.
The additional weight m creates a gravitational force mg acting downward.
This gravitational force must balance the reversed magnetic force on the coil.
When the current is reversed, the magnetic force becomes -nILB, and the balance condition is nILB = mg.
Rearrange the equation to solve for B: B = mg/nIL.
